intro: Clypea effusa, commonly known as the broadleaf clypea, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are usually broad and have a distinctive, slightly lobed appearance. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Clypea effusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
